revised_title: Conjectures on the Nature of Intermitting and Reciprocating Springs
tldr: The author, Joseph Atwell, presents conjectures on the nature of intermitting and reciprocating springs, specifically focusing on a fountain in Laywell, near Torbay in Devonshire. He observes the fountain's regular increase and decrease in water flow and discusses the possible factors influencing these phenomena. Atwell's observations and conjectures provide insights into the behavior of springs and contribute to the understanding of natural phenomena.
